thread.title: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Bangor
thread.title_full: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Bangor

title: Moravian Academy field hockey team downs Bangor
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Moravian Academy 3, Bangor 1 -- Rapid recap 
The Moravian Academy field hockey team had a tough battle on its hands Wednesday afternoon but remained unbeaten with a 3-1 Colonial League victory over host Bangor . 
Turning point : Junior midfielder Cecily Redfern scored to give Moravian a 3-1 lead with 12:40 left in the game. The goal came nine minutes after Bangor pulled within 2-1 and had momentum on a goal by Montana Ott. 
Top performers : Redfern and Mayv Clune , a junior forward, each had a goal and an assist for the Lions. Bangor freshman goalkeeper Morgan Pysher turned in an outstanding performance with 21 saves in a losing cause. 
What it means : Moravian Academy, which is clearly the class of the Colonial League, will finish as the No. 1 seed for next week's league tournament. Bangor, which will likely be Moravian's opponent in the first round, showed marked improvement from the first meeting between the teams, which Moravian won 9-0. 
Tom Hinkel may be reached at thinkel@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @TomHinkelLV . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook
